resources.string: "You have new messages from your Corona-Warn-App."
"Please share your test result and warn others."
"There is important news. Please open your Corona-Warn-App."
"Please note, you can only use the Corona-Warn-App again once you have installed the latest update."
"Exposure logging was active for %1$s of the past 14 days."
"Note: Please open the app daily to update your risk status."
"Activate exposure logging to evaluate your risk status today."
"Since you have not activated exposure logging for long enough, we could not calculate your risk of infection."
"Your exposure logging could not be updated for more than 24 hours."
"Your risk status has not been updated for more than 48 hours. Please update your risk status."
"The synchronization of random IDs with the server failed. You can restart the synchronization manually."

resources.string: "This may take several minutes. Thank you for your patience."
"Your exposure data is being checked. This may take several minutes. Thank you for your patience."
"Here you can find answers to frequently asked questions about the Corona-Warn-App. You will be forwarded to an external German government website."
"Here you can find answers to frequently asked questions about the Corona-Warn-App. You will be forwarded to an external website."
"The more people who use the app, the faster we can break chains of infection. Please invite your family and friends to download the app."

"Fighting coronavirus together""
""I'm in on this, you too?""
""https://www.corona-warn-app.de""
""
"
"A man shares the Corona-Warn-App with four other persons."
"Exposure logging is one of the three central features of the app. When you activate it, encounters with people\'s smartphones are logged. You don\'t have to do anything else."

"If you have had contact within the last 14 days with a person who was diagnosed with coronavirus, the app calculates your personal risk of infection. It does this by measuring duration and proximity of the exposure."
"The following risk status can be shown:"
"Another central feature is registering your test and retrieving the result. If you are diagnosed with coronavirus, you can notify others and break the chain of infection."

"List of received and temporary random IDs saved temporarily in the operating system storage. This list is read when the exposures are checked. All random IDs are automatically deleted after 14 days."
"Exposure log data is retrieved and synchronized with reported infections of other users. Your risk is checked automatically several times per day."

"Exposure to an infected person who has shared their positive test results with others through the app. An exposure must meet certain criteria with regard to duration, distance, and suspected infectiousness of the other person to be classified as a high-risk exposure."
"The display of exposures in the Corona-Warn-App."

"Random IDs are combinations of digits and letters generated randomly. They are exchanged between devices in close proximity. Random IDs cannot be traced to a specific person and are automatically deleted after 14 days. Persons diagnosed with coronavirus can opt to share their random IDs of up to the last 14 days with other app users."
"A smartphone displays various content, numbered 1 to 3."
"Why your risk of infection is low"

"You encountered a person who was later diagnosed with coronavirus. Nevertheless, based on your exposure logging data, your risk of infection is low. The risk is low if your encounter was brief or occurred at a distance. You do not need to worry and there is no specific need for action. We recommend that you adhere to the prevailing rules regarding distancing and hygiene."
"If possible, please go home and stay at home."
"If you have questions about symptoms, testing availability, or self-isolation, please contact one of the following:"
"Wash your hands regularly, with soap, for 20 seconds."
"Wear a face mask when you encounter other people."
"Keep at least 1.5 meters distance from other people."
"Sneeze or cough into your elbow or a tissue."
"General medical emergency service on telephone number 116117"
"This period is included in the calculation."
"Your risk of infection can be calculated only for periods during which exposure logging was active. The logging feature should therefore remain active permanently."

"Exposure logging covers the past 14 days. During this time, the logging feature on your smartphone was active for %1$s days. The app automatically deletes older logs, as these are no longer relevant for infection prevention."
"This is how your risk was calculated."
"This is how your risk is calculated."
"Your exposure logging could not be updated for more than 24 hours."
"You have a low risk of infection because no exposure to people later diagnosed with COVID-19 was logged, or because your encounters were only for a short time and at a greater distance."

"The risk of infection is calculated locally on your smartphone, using exposure logging data. The calculation also takes into account distance and duration of any exposure to persons diagnosed with coronavirus, as well as their potential infectiousness. Your risk of infection cannot be seen by or passed on to anyone else."

plurals.name: risk_details_information_body_increased_risk
plurals.item: "You have an increased risk of infection because you were last exposed %1$s days ago over a longer period of time and at close proximity to at least one person diagnosed with coronavirus."
"You have an increased risk of infection because you were last exposed %1$s days ago over a longer period of time and at close proximity to at least one person diagnosed with coronavirus."
"You have an increased risk of infection because you were last exposed %1$s days ago over a longer period of time and at close proximity to at least one person diagnosed with coronavirus."
"You have an increased risk of infection because you were last exposed %1$s days ago over a longer period of time and at close proximity to at least one person diagnosed with coronavirus."
"You have an increased risk of infection because you were last exposed %1$s days ago over a longer period of time and at close proximity to at least one person diagnosed with coronavirus."
"You have an increased risk of infection because you were last exposed %1$s days ago over a longer period of time and at close proximity to at least one person diagnosed with coronavirus."

resources.string: "Your risk of infection is calculated from the exposure logging data (duration and proximity) locally on your smartphone. Your risk of infection cannot be seen by, or passed on to, anyone else."

"Therefore, your risk of infection has been ranked as increased. Your risk of infection is calculated from the exposure logging data (duration and proximity) locally on your smartphone. Your risk of infection cannot be seen by, or passed on to, anyone else. When you get home, please also avoid close contact with members of your family or household."
"For further information, please see our FAQ page."
"Please remember to open the Corona-Warn-App regularly to check your risk status."

"The last exposure that resulted in your increased risk was more than 14 days ago. Therefore, your risk of infection has been ranked as low again.

This is what you should do:
1. If you do not have any COVID-19 symptoms, continue to follow the prevailing rules regarding distancing and hygiene.
2. If you have COVID-19 symptoms, we recommend that you visit your doctor and get tested."
"More protection for you and for us all. By using the Corona-Warn-App we can break chains of infection much quicker."

"Turn your smartphone into a coronavirus warning system. Get an overview of your risk status and find out whether you\'ve had close contact with anyone diagnosed with coronavirus in the last 14 days."
"The app logs encounters between individuals by exchanging encrypted, random IDs between their smartphones, whereby no personal data whatsoever is accessed."
"A group of persons use their smartphones around town."
"Onboarding page 2 of 6: Data Privacy. A long text follows. To proceed at any time, use the button at the bottom of the screen."
"A woman uses the Corona-Warn-App on her smartphone. An icon showing a padlock on the background of a shield symbolizes encrypted data."
"Onboarding page 3 of 6: How to Enable Exposure Logging"
"To identify whether you are at risk of infection, you must activate exposure logging."

"Exposure logging works by your Android smartphone receiving, via Bluetooth, encrypted random IDs of other users and passing your own random IDs to their smartphones. Exposure logging can be deactivated at any time. "
"The encrypted random IDs only pass information about date, duration, and proximity (calculated from signal strength) to other people. Individuals cannot be identified based on the random IDs."

string.name: onboarding_tracing_easy_language_explanation
string.a: "App Information in Simplified Language and Sign Language"

resources.string: "This means the Corona-Warn-App cannot send or receive notifications about your COVID-19 risk status. You can deactivate this feature at any time."

"You have deactivated background updates for the Corona-Warn-App. Please activate background updates to use automatic exposure logging. If you do not activate background updates, you can only start exposure logging manually in the app. You can activate background updates for the app in your device settings."

"Enable prioritized background activity to allow the app to determine your risk status in the background any time (recommended). This disables battery life optimization for the Corona-Warn-App only. We do not expect this to cause a significant decrease in your smartphone\'s battery life.\n\nIf you do not allow this setting, we recommend you to open the app manually at least once every 24 hours."

"Please note that with prioritized background activity disabled, you have to open the app manually at least once every 24 hours to update your risk status.\n\nYou can enable prioritized background activity in your settings any time."
"Three persons have activated exposure logging on their smartphones, which will log their encounters with each other."
"Your location cannot be accessed. Google and/or Android requires access to your smartphone\'s location to use Bluetooth."
"Onboarding page 5 of 6: If You Are Diagnosed with Coronavirus"
"… please report this in the Corona-Warn-App. Sharing your test results is voluntary and secure. Please do this for the sake of everyone\'s health."

"Your notification is encrypted securely and processed on a secure server. People whose encrypted random IDs your smartphone has collected will now receive a warning along with information about what they should now do."
"An encrypted positive test diagnosis is transmitted to the system, which will now warn other users."
"Onboarding page 6 of 6: Receive warnings and identify risks"
"The app can notify you automatically about your risk status and warn you about new infections of people you have been exposed to. Allow the app now to notify you."
"You can then self-isolate to protect others and find out where you can get tested."
"A woman receives a notification from her Corona-Warn-App."
"The use of this app is intended for persons who are at least 16 years of age and who reside in Germany."
"Allow creation and sharing of COVID-19 random IDs."

"You need to enable the exposure logging feature so that the app can determine whether you are at risk after encountering an infected app user. The exposure logging feature works transnationally, meaning any possible exposure involving users is also detected by other official coronavirus apps.

The exposure logging feature works by your Android smartphone receiving encrypted random IDs from other users via Bluetooth and passing your own random IDs to their smartphones. Every day, the app downloads a list containing the random IDs – along with any voluntary information about the onset of symptoms – of all users who have tested positive for the virus and voluntarily shared this information (specifically: their random IDs) via their app. This list is then compared with the random IDs of other users you have encountered that have been recorded by your Android smartphone, in order to calculate the likelihood that you have also been infected and to warn you if necessary. You can use the toggle switch to disable exposure logging at any time.

The app never collects personal data such as your name, address or location, nor is this information passed on to other users. It is not possible to use random IDs to draw conclusions about individual persons."
"Bluetooth must be turned on for exposure logging in order to log encounters. Please turn on Bluetooth in your device settings."

"Activate your location services. Bluetooth Low Energy requires activated location services to calculate physical distances, but does not access your location. For further information, please see our FAQ page."
"Exposure logging requires an Internet connection to calculate exposures. Please turn on WIFI or mobile data in your device settings."

plurals.name: settings_tracing_status_body_active
plurals.item: "Exposure logging has been active for one day.\nAn exposure check can only be reliable if exposure logging is permanently activated."
"Exposure logging has been active for %1$s days.\nAn exposure check can only be reliable if exposure logging is permanently activated."
"Exposure logging has been active for %1$s days.\nAn exposure check can only be reliable if exposure logging is permanently activated."
"Exposure logging has been active for %1$s days.\nAn exposure check can only be reliable if exposure logging is permanently activated."
"Exposure logging has been active for %1$s days.\nAn exposure check can only be reliable if exposure logging is permanently activated."
"Exposure logging has been active for %1$s days.\nAn exposure check can only be reliable if exposure logging is permanently activated."

resources.string: "Three persons have activated exposure logging on their smartphones, which will log their encounters with each other."
"A person has deactivated exposure logging on their smartphone, so an encounter with two other persons is not logged."
"A person has turned off Bluetooth on their smartphone, so an encounter with two other persons is not logged."
"A person has turned off the Internet connection on their smartphone, so an encounter with two other persons is not logged."
"Do you want to activate notifications of your COVID-19 risk status?"
"Allow automatic notifications of COVID-19 risk status"
"Specify which areas you want to continue to receive notifications for."
"To activate notifications, you must allow notifications for the Corona-Warn-App in your device settings."
"A woman receives a notification from her Corona-Warn-App."
"A woman has deactivated notifications for her Corona-Warn-App."
"Delete all your data in the app."
"Are you sure you want to reset the app?"
"You will no longer be notified of your exposures and you will no longer be able to warn other users."
"The exposure log must be deleted separately in your device settings."
"A hand holds a smartphone displaying a symbol indicating that the app is being reset."
"You will no longer be notified of your exposures and you will no longer be able to warn other users. This procedure cannot be undone."
"If you activate prioritized background activity, the app can determine your risk status at any time. This disables battery life optimization for the Corona-Warn-App only."
"You can activate and deactivate prioritized background activity in your device settings."

"Robert Koch Institute (RKI) is Germany’s federal public health body. The RKI publishes the Corona-Warn-App on behalf of the Federal Government. The app is intended as a digital complement to public health measures already introduced: social distancing, hygiene, and face masks."

"People who use the app help to trace and break chains of infection. The app saves encounters with other people locally on your device. You are notified if you have encountered people who were later diagnosed with coronavirus. Your identity and privacy are always protected."
"A group of persons use their smartphones around town."
"A woman uses the Corona-Warn-App on her smartphone. An icon showing a padlock on the background of a shield symbolizes encrypted data."
"A hand holds a smartphone displaying a large body of text on the screen. Next to the text is a tick mark symbolizing that the terms of use have been accepted."

"For technical questions about the Corona-Warn-App, please contact our hotline.\n\nPersons with hearing impairments can use Tess Relay services (interpreting between German written language and sign language) to contact the phone hotline. You can download the software from Google Play."
"Our customer service is here to help."

"Languages: English, German, Turkish
Business hours:""
""Monday to Saturday: 7am - 10pm""
(except national holidays)""
The call is free of charge."
"If you have any health-related questions, please contact your general practitioner or the medical emergency service hotline, telephone: 116 117."
"A man wears a headset while making a phone call."
"Frequently asked questions. You will be forwarded to an external web site."
"A hand holds a smartphone displaying a large body of text on the screen. Next to the text is a balance scale that symbolizes legal notices."
"(responsible in accordance with § 5, para. 1 TMG, § 55 para. 1 RStV, DS-GVO, BDSG)"

"Robert Koch Institute""
""Nordufer 20""
""13353 Berlin""
""
""represented by its president"
"A hand holds a smartphone displaying a large body of text on the screen. Next to the text is a section symbol representing the imprint."
"Connection could not be established (%1$d). Please try again."
"Connection could not be established. Please try again."

"The QR code is invalid or has been registered on another smartphone already. You will receive your test result from the test center or laboratory regardless of the validity of the QR code. If you are diagnosed with coronavirus, you will be notified by the public health authority."
"The TAN is invalid or has already been used. For further information, call the number listed under \"Request TAN\"."
"A TAN for submission could not be generated. Please contact the technical hotline via App Information → Technical Hotline."
"The generated TAN is invalid for submission. Please contact the technical hotline via App Information → Technical Hotline."
"Your test is more than 21 days old and can no longer be registered in the app. If you are tested again in future, please make sure to scan the QR code as soon as you get it."
"Do you want to cancel entering your symptoms?"
"If you provide information about your symptoms, you can warn others more exactly."
"Allow the app to use the camera to scan the QR code."
"Please call up the system settings and allow the app to use the camera to scan the QR code."

"The QR code is invalid or has been registered on another smartphone already. You will receive your test result from the test center or laboratory regardless of the validity of the QR code. If you are diagnosed with coronavirus, the public health authority will be notified through the legally prescribed channel and will contact you."
"Position the QR code in the frame."
"Position the QR code in the frame."
"Your consent is needed before you can retrieve your test result and warn others."
"In the next step, scan the QR code on your test and retrieve your test result."
"Your test can only be scanned once. The app cannot manage multiple tests at the same time."
"Please help others you have encountered by warning them!"
"If you have been diagnosed with coronavirus, you can warn others through the app. The warning feature works in several countries. The following countries are currently participating:"
"Detailed Information on Data Processing and Your Consent"
"You can retrieve your test result even if you do not choose to share it. But if you share your test result, you will help to protect others against infection."
"Your identity will remain secret. Other users will not find out who has shared a test result."
"You must be at least 16 years old to grant your consent."
"Your test has been stored in the Corona-Warn-App."
"Your test result is not available yet."
"As soon as your test result becomes available, it will be displayed in the app."
"The laboratory result indicates no verification that you have the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus.\n\nPlease delete the test from the Corona-Warn-App, so that you can save a new test code here if necessary."
"Share your random IDs and warn others.\nHelp determine the risk of infection for others more accurately by also indicating when you first noticed any coronavirus symptoms."

"There was a problem evaluating your test. Please contact the test center or laboratory involved to find out how to proceed.\n\nPlease delete the test from your Corona-Warn-App so that you will be able to save a new test code there, if necessary."
"Please activate exposure logging to warn other people."
"The test can only be scanned once."

"If you remove the test, you can no longer retrieve your test result. You will receive your test result from the test center or laboratory regardless of the validity of the QR code. If you are diagnosed with coronavirus, the public health authority will be notified through the legally prescribed channel and will contact you."
"You have been diagnosed with the SARS-CoV-2 virus."
"Thank you for helping to stop the spread of coronavirus."

"Others you have had contact with will now be warned."" "
"You can now help to improve the accuracy of the warnings. To do so, in the next step, tell us when you first developed symptoms. You can cancel this step at any time."
"Please enter the 10-digit TAN that you were given."
"Your entry contains invalid characters. Please check your entry."
"Retrieve your test result through the app and then warn others. You’ll protect yourself and help to stop the spread of coronavirus."
"Register your test by scanning the QR code of your test document."
"Do you have a TAN? Tap here to enter your TAN so you can warn others. "

"If you wish, you can now ensure that others are warned of possible infection.

To do so, you can transmit your own random IDs from the last 14 days – and, optionally, information about when you first noticed coronavirus symptoms – to the server operated jointly by the participating countries. From there, your random IDs and any additional information will be distributed to the users of the relevant official coronavirus apps. In this way, any other users with whom you have had contact can be warned of a possible infection.

The only information transmitted will be your random IDs and any optional information you provide about the onset of your symptoms. No personal data such as your name, address or location will be disclosed."
"A smartphone transmits an encrypted positive test diagnosis to the system."
"The following countries currently participate in transnational exposure logging:"
"Because you tested positive for coronavirus, you can now warn others through the app."
"The warning feature works in several countries. The following countries are currently participating:"

string.name: submission_test_result_positive_no_consent_text_1
string.b: "Share your test result and help protect others against infection."

resources.string: "Your identity will remain secret. Other users will not find out who has shared a test result."
"Please be sure to follow the instructions from your public health authority and stay home, so you don’t infect others."
"Which countries have you visited in the last 14 days?"
"Your entry is used solely for optimizing the data volume.\n\nThe list contains all currently participating countries and is continuously updated."
"Thanks to your support, other people can now be warned and respond appropriately."
"The public health authority will contact you within the next few days."

string-array.name: submission_done_further_info_bullet_points
string-array.item: "Your quarantine period is usually 14 days. Please observe your symptoms and monitor how they develop."

"You will be asked by your public health authority to create a list of people you have had contact with. This should include all people with whom you have had close contact with (less than 2 meters, face-to-face conversation) for over 15 minutes in the two days before you developed symptoms."
"Please particularly consider people who will not be notified directly by the app since they don\'t own a smartphone, or haven\'t installed the app."
"Even when you no longer have any symptoms and you feel well again, you could still be infectious."

resources.string: "Have you experienced one or more of the following symptoms in the past few days?"
"Thank you for helping to stop the spread of coronavirus."
"You can now help to improve the accuracy of the warnings. To do so, in the next step, tell us when you first developed symptoms. You can cancel this step at any time."
"Several people are looking at their smartphones."
"Have you experienced one or more of the following symptoms in the last few days?"

"You can indicate whether and when you noticed any coronavirus symptoms, to allow the app to calculate more accurately the risk of infection to other app users. This step is voluntary. If you do not want to provide information about your symptoms, select “No answer”."

"Please keep your test result (if available) and your phone number ready to request a TAN.\n\nPeople with hearing impairments can use Tess Relay services (interpreting between German written language and sign language) to contact the phone hotline. You can download the software from Google Play."
"Call the hotline and request a TAN:"
"Register the test by entering the TAN in the app."

"Languages: 
English, German, Turkish

Business hours:
Monday to Sunday: 24 hours

The call is free of charge."
"If you have any health-related questions, please contact your general practitioner or the medical emergency service hotline, telephone: 116 117."
"Call the hotline and request a TAN"

"In the first step, you call the hotline and request your TAN. You can reach the hotline on +49 800 7540002. The business hours are Monday to Friday from 8 am to 10 pm and Saturday and Sunday from 10 am to 10 pm. The call is free of charge."
"In the second step, you register your test with your TAN in the app."
"When did you first notice the symptoms?"
"Please specify the date as accurately as possible."
"Your test result is not available yet"
"You can now retrieve your test result"
"The evaluation of your test is not yet done."
"You have been diagnosed positive for SARS-CoV-2."
"You have been diagnosed negative for SARS-CoV-2."
"If you have tested positive for coronavirus, you can warn others."
"Your test is more than 21 days old and is therefore no longer relevant. Please delete the test. You can then add another."
"You are infectious. Isolate yourself from other people."
"The public health authority will contact you within the next few days."
"Share your random IDs so that others can be warned."

string-array.name: test_result_card_negative_further_info_bullet_points
string-array.item: "Still feeling unwell? If you feel very poorly and/or your symptoms have worsened, please contact your general practitioner."
"Remain at home until you feel well again. If you were to get infected with coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) whilst weakened from another infection, this could lead to a serious illness."
"Do not go to work if you feel unwell to ensure you do not put other people at risk."
"If your symptoms worsen, you might need a further SARS-CoV-2 test."

resources.string: "A woman holds her smartphone in her hand. It is sending a signal to another smartphone."
"Thank you for agreeing to share your test result and helping to warn others as a result. \n\n""In the next step, please share your test result by tapping “Share”."

"You have chosen not to share your test result. Others will not be warned. \n\nIn the next step, you have the opportunity to change your mind and share your test result after all, to help stop the spread of coronavirus and protect others."
"Important:\nYou are about to cancel this process.\nYou have not warned others yet. Please complete the process and help to protect others."
"Do you really want to cancel the process?"
"Detailed Information on Data Processing and Your Consent"
"You are not connected to the Internet."
"You do not have sufficient free memory."
"You cannot perform this action. Please contact the hotline."

"Your Corona-Warn-App is correctly installed, but the \"COVID-19 Exposure Notifications System\" is not available on your smartphone\'s operating system. This means that you cannot use the Corona-Warn-App. For further information, please see our FAQ page: https://www.coronawarn.app/en/faq/"

"The Corona-Warn-App is running correctly, but we cannot update your current risk status. Exposure logging remains active and is working correctly. For further information, please see our FAQ page: https://www.coronawarn.app/en/faq/"
"No more exposure checks possible today, as you have reached the maximum number of checks per day defined by your operating system. Please check your risik status again tomorrow."

"Your app was reset due to a technical problem. This has no effect exposure logging or your risk status. You will continue to be notified about exposures and still be able to warn others, should you be tested positive for COVID-19. Please note, however, that the app reset means any read QR codes for the electronic notification of your test results have been lost. In this case, please contact your doctor or the testing lab to find out your test result."
"Get Exposure keys (my keys history from api)"

"Several countries are working together to enable transnational alerts via a joint exchange server. For example, contacts with users of an official coronavirus app from other participating countries can also be taken into account for exposure logging."

"To do this, the app downloads lists, which are updated daily, of the random IDs of all users who have shared their test results to warn others via their own app. This list is then compared with the random IDs recorded by your Android smartphone. The downloads of the lists of random IDs are usually free of charge for you. Specifically, this means that mobile network operators do not charge you for the data used by the app in this context, nor do they apply roaming charges for this in other EU countries. Please contact your mobile network operator for more information."
"The following countries currently participate in transnational exposure logging:"

"The app’s privacy notice (including information about the data processing carried out for the transnational exposure logging feature) can be found in the menu under “App Information” > “Data Privacy”."

"Several countries have teamed up to enable transnational warnings. In other words, your potential exposure to users of the official coronavirus apps in all participating countries can now be taken into account."

"When a user submits their positive test result (more specifically: their random IDs) to warn others through the exchange server jointly operated by the participating countries, all users of the official coronavirus apps in all these countries can be warned of their potential exposure."

"The daily downloads of lists of random IDs from users who have shared positive test results are usually free of charge for you. Specifically, this means that mobile network operators do not charge you for the data used by the app in this context, nor do they apply roaming charges for this in other EU countries. Please contact your mobile network operator for more information."
"The terms of use have also been updated, to reflect the functional enhancements in the app."

"The Terms of Use and privacy notice can also be found in the menu under “App Information” and in the app description in your app store. The changes will not affect how you use the app. If you continue to use the app or reopen it, we will assume that you agree to the updated Terms of Use."

"The features of the Corona-Warn-App have been enhanced. Many countries have joined up to enable international warnings, based on a jointly-operated exchange server. Exposure to users of official coronavirus apps in other participating countries can now be taken into account when calculating your exposure risk."

"To do this, the app downloads lists, which are updated daily, of the random IDs of all users who have shared their test results to warn others via their own app. This list is then compared with the random IDs recorded by your Android smartphone."

"The list downloads are usually free of charge for you. Specifically, this means that mobile network operators do not charge you for the data used by the app in this context, nor do they apply roaming charges for this in other EU countries. Please contact your mobile network operator for more information."
"A hand holds a smartphone. Europe and the European flag are illustrated in the background."
"You can view the participating countries in the exposure logging details."
"Your Internet connection may have been lost. Please ensure that you are connected to the Internet."
"Don’t you want to send a warning?"
"You have to share your test result if you want to warn others."
